page.title: 03Cannington Park, Cannington
page.content: Near the village is a rough hill known as Cannington Park. It is 80 metres high and is covered with trees and shrubland. The crest of the hill is encircled by the ditches of an Iron Age camp. The Ministry of Works carried out an excavation in 1963 because quarrying was about to destroy the remaining portion of this ancient cemeteny, some 400 skeletons were removed and it was proved to be a burial ground which had been in use from Romen Times until about 650 A.D. Before quarrying began in the early 19th Century it is assumed that there must have been two or even three thousand burials in this field.
